byline.contributor: Christine Hauser, Daniel Victor and Jon Hurdle contributed reporting.
byline.original: By SYDNEY EMBER and GRAHAM BOWLEY

abstract: Pennsylvania prosecutors charge Bill Cosby with felony indecent assault; charges stem from accusation that Cosby drugged and sexually abused Andrea Constand in 2004; prosecutors say decision followed emergence of new evidence as dozens of women nationwide came forward to accuse Cosby of sexual assault.
lead_paragraph: The comedian, who has for decades been pursued by allegations of sexual misconduct, was charged with sexual assault in Pennsylvania in a case that many people, including women who had come forward, thought prosecutors would never bring.

headline.main: Bill Cosby Charged in Sexual Assault Case
headline.print_headline: Cosby Is Charged With Sex Assault in Criminal Case

snippet: The comedian, who has for decades been pursued by allegations of sexual misconduct, was charged with sexual assault in Pennsylvania in a case that many people, including women who had come forward, thought prosecutors would never bring.
